1.subject: Mathematics
1.name: Sine Formula
1.text:
\[ \begin{align*} \text{Sine Law:} \\ \frac{a}{sin{A}}&=\frac{b}{sin{B}}=\frac{c}{sin{C}} \text{ or } \\ \frac{sin{A}}{a}&=\frac{sin{B}}{b}=\frac{sin{C}}{c} \\ \end{align*} \]

This is commonly used when you have to find specific lines/angles in a triangle, when you find some pairs.

2.name: Logarithm of the same number as base
